item.title: Github Pages and Jekyll - sitemap
item.author: Author
item.description:
Update

I’ve moved from Jekyll to Hugo.
This method only fits Jekyll.

Sitemap

A sitemap is a .xml file that contains the links to all the pages inside a website.
With a sitemap,
a search engine knows the pages and can therefore create indexes for them.
Then, people surfing the internet can find those pages with keywords after that.

Jekyll-sitemap

There is a plugin called jekyll-stiemap for Jekyll,
which generates a sitemap automatically whenever the website is re-building.

item.title: C/C++ - const with Pointer or Reference
item.author: Author
item.description:
const with Normal Variables

Two ways to add const for normal variables:

const TYPE NAME = VALUE; // more common
TYPE const NAME = VAULE;

Both means this variable cannot be assigned to another value.

item.title: Difference between Concurrent Processing and Parallel Processing
item.author: Author
item.description:
Both ‘Concurrent Processing’ and ‘Parallel Processing’ refer to multiple processes is executing by the CPU in a period,
but they are two different things.
